title: Exclusive Q&A Session 73| Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami |22-12-22
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: If a wrong person has got some skill, he can misuse it.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why Dronacharya asked Ekalavya for his thumb as Guru Dakshina, relating it to the idea that unqualified individuals may misuse knowledge or skills, similar to the concept of Shudras not being taught the Vedas.
segments.transcript: Why did Dronacharya ask Ekalavya to give his thumb as Guru Dakshina? Is it to show the importance of surrendering to Guru or is it because Ekalavya was violating social order? Actually, Ekalavya was not a proper qualified person to have that skill of shooting arrows. If a wrong person has got some skill, he can misuse it. It is just like it is said in the scriptures itself. Shudras are not taught the Vedas. Why? That's because the Shudras don't have the intelligence to properly utilize the Vedic knowledge and use it for everyone's welfare, good. They may misuse it for some bad purposes or wrong purposes. It is just like somebody is a terrorist, he should not have weapons because he will misuse it like that. So, Ekalavya was not actually qualified to have the skill of shooting arrows. So, by asking him to give his thumb as Guru Dakshina, Dronacharya actually cut down his ability to use that skill, because the thumb is very important in actually shooting using a bow and arrow. So, that way he curtailed his usage for the social good, for the good of everyone else.

segments.key_quote: And to make our destination as Vaikuntha is the correct goal of life.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the significance of Vaikuntha Ekadashi and passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara, emphasizing that it should remind us to make Vaikuntha our destination after death and to understand our spiritual nature.
segments.transcript: It is said that by passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara, one can attain Vaikuntha, where can we find the source of the statement? This is said in one of the Puranas. Now, the significance of Vaikuntha Ekadashi, the day on which this festival is celebrated, especially in Vishnu temples, that one can pass through Vaikuntha Dwaara, that is to remind us that our destination should be Vaikuntha after quitting this body. And to make our destination as Vaikuntha is the correct goal of life. Otherwise, people either they do not have a goal of life in the sense that when we quit this body, which we are forced to do at the time of death, then where do I go? That people do not even know that they are spirit, soul and they are eternal. That itself they do not know. So, this is a particular important point that you understand. Attaining Vaikuntha means you understand I am spirit, soul. I don't die at the time of death. I change body. So, if I prepare myself, I can get a spiritual body and in that spiritual body I can attain Vaikuntha Loka. For eternal life full of bliss and knowledge that is awaiting us. If we want to go there, if we understand the importance of practicing Bhakti in order to go there,

segments.key_quote: Passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara is to remind ourselves that we should prepare our consciousness by purifying it of all material contamination.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the need to purify our consciousness from material contamination to attain Vaikuntha, highlighting that material desires prevent us from entering the spiritual world.
segments.transcript: So, merely doing a ritual of passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara is not enough. Passing through Vaikuntha Dwaara is to remind ourselves that we should prepare our consciousness by purifying it of all material contamination. So, the Supreme Lord is very eager to take us back to his personal abode called Vaikuntha. And he wants us to qualify. Qualify in what sense? Due to long association with this material nature, our consciousness has become polluted by material desires, by material reactions, by material contamination. So, to purify this is essential. As long as we have material contamination or material desires, we have to keep taking birth in this material world. Because those desires can be fulfilled only in this material world. Material contamination is not permitted in the spiritual world. Spiritual world, everything is spiritual. The Supreme Lord is completely spiritual. His abode is completely spiritual. The devotees are completely spiritually situated. So, everything is spiritual there. Nothing is material. So, therefore, we have to prepare ourselves. And anyway, that is our original position. As spirit soul, we belong to the spiritual world. We have a relationship with the Supreme Lord in his personal abode. And he is our maintainer. He is our protector. He is our well-wisher. He is our everything in the spiritual world. But then if we remain with this material desires or material comforts or material aspirations, then we cannot leave this world and go away.

segments.key_quote: This going through Vaikuntha Dwara is to remind us that prepare yourself before death comes. Become Krishna conscious.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how to remember Krishna's form, particularly through deity worship and connecting with Krishna's teachings, to prepare for approaching the spiritual kingdom.
segments.transcript: So, please remember, this going through Vaikuntha Dwara is to remind us that prepare yourself before death comes. Become Krishna conscious. And be ready to go to the abode of the Supreme Lord Vaikuntha. Next question. In the introduction to Bhagavad Gita As It Is, Srila Prabhupada says, if one remembers the form of Krishna at a time of death, he can approach the spiritual kingdom. What is this form and how to remember? Okay. The form of Krishna, Krishna is present in several different forms. The easiest way to understand form of Krishna is the form of the deity of Krishna, Krishna Vikraha, Archa Vikraha. You go to any temple of Krishna, there is the Krishna deity. Deity, Vikraha. So, that is one form of Krishna, the particular deity in a particular temple. So, remembering that form, how do you remember that form? When you go to the temple, you completely concentrate your attention on the form of Krishna as the deity and get the impression in your heart. And carry that impression with you even after you die. Even after you leave the temple and go away to your home or office and remember that form and pray and hear the glories of Krishna from the Bhagavatam. Learn the instructions of Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita. All this you connect with that remembrance of the form of Krishna. Krishna is my supreme well-wisher. Krishna is my maintainer. Krishna is my beloved Lord. Krishna is the ultimate source of everything. Krishna is full of all unlimited good qualities. Like this, thinking of Krishna, talking about Krishna, remembering Krishna's form within the heart and hearing about Krishna, taking Krishna Prasadam, worshipping the deity of Krishna or picture of the deity of Krishna, all this actually prepares us

segments.key_quote: Krishna will give us remembrance of Him at the time of death and take us back to God.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that remembering Krishna at the time of death is possible through the Lord's mercy, which is attained by consistent practice of remembering Him in this material world.
segments.transcript: But remembering at the time of death is made possible by the mercy of the Supreme Lord who is situated in our heart. If we endeavor to try to remember while we are in this material world doing so many different activities, simultaneously we try to remember Krishna, practice remembering Him constantly, then Krishna will give us remembrance of Him at the time of death and take us back to God.

segments.key_quote: Maha Vishnu first appears, enters the material energy which is lying in a dormant condition, unmanifest condition.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the process of material creation, starting with Maha Vishnu entering the dormant material energy and leading to the birth of Brahma from Garbhodaka Shaini Vishnu.
segments.transcript: In the third canto, when Lord Brahma offers His praise to Vishnu, did He offer the prayers before the material creation or after the creation? Now the material creation it's a long process. It begins with the Supreme Lord incarnating in this material world, in the material energy. The Lord enters as the first Vishnu form from the spiritual world who descends into this material energy. So that is called Karanodaka Shaini Vishnu, also called Maha Vishnu. So Maha Vishnu first appears, enters the material energy which is lying in a dormant condition, unmanifest condition. That means at that time there are no universes. Previous destruction took place and there was only the material energy. So that energy first of all Maha Vishnu enters. Then Maha Vishnu agitates that energy and the energy becomes activated by Maha Vishnu's glance. And then after Maha Vishnu's glance, first of all the agitation produces Mahatatva. And Mahatatva differentiates the elements. And those elements are combined to form varieties of material objects, material planets. And then from there is one expansion of this Maha Vishnu called Padmanabha Vishnu or Garbhodaka Shaini Vishnu. So that Garbhodaka Shaini Vishnu from his navel one lotus flower is born. On that Brahma is created by Vishnu.

segments.key_quote: Brahma then understands that he is to do the secondary creation. What is secondary creation? The primary creation is the creation of the ingredients for the creation.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Brahma's role in secondary creation, which involves creating bodies for living entities, after Vishnu has already created the elements.
segments.transcript: And Brahma after his creation, he doesn't know who he is, he doesn't know where he is, he doesn't know what he is supposed to do. So he began searching out for a source and he begins contemplation. Who am I? Where have I come from? What am I supposed to do? Etc, etc. So then Lord Vishnu actually who is seated in the heart of Brahma, he enlightens Brahma, gives knowledge to Brahma and Brahma then understands that he is to do the secondary creation. What is secondary creation? The primary creation is the creation of the ingredients for the creation. That is all the elements earth, water, fire, air, sky, mind, intelligence, objects, everything is the elements. That is done by Maha Vishnu through agitation of the material energy. Then Brahma, birth of Brahma is done by Garboda Darsahi Vishnu. Then Brahma is given knowledge and enlightenment by Vishnu. Then Brahma can create the living entities, the bodies, living entities means the bodies, he can give the bodies for the living entities. By bringing forth the different varieties of the species. So that gives the bodies to the living entities or helping them take birth in this material world. So that is the work of creation of Brahma. After Brahma is born and already Vishnu has done the work of creation to the point of generating the elements, then Brahma actually does the further work of creation of generating the living beings with their proper bodies in the different planets that take birth according to their past karma. That is work of Brahma to generate the living entities. So before he can actually generate the living entities, he offers prayers to Vishnu

segments.key_quote: The prayers offered by Brahma is after the initial phase of, different phases of the creation are done by the two Vishnus and then Brahma's work has to begin of generating the living beings given the material body that is the work of creation of Brahma
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Brahma's prayers to Vishnu before creating living entities, expressing sorrow for their inevitable suffering and the cycle of birth and death.
segments.transcript: that he may not become entangled. That he feels sorry for the living beings that he has to be responsible for giving them bodies through which they will no doubt get some enjoyment but they will also have to suffer so many miseries. He feels very sorry for them and he also sees their condition is going to be like they are born in when they are born they are ignorant and foolishly they become busy with material enjoyment and they remain in ignorance and after death again and again they keep taking birth but at the time of dissolution of the whole universe they again are helplessly absorbed in the material energy and they remain dormant like that for billions and billions of years and again they come out again they are busy with material enjoyment. So they can remain in this cycle unless they are rescued by a pure devotee or the Lord himself. So therefore the prayers offered by Brahma is after the initial phase of, different phases of the creation are done by the two Vishnus and then Brahma's work has to begin of generating the living beings given the material body that is the work of creation of Brahma and that happened before he has to do that he offers nice prayers to

segments.key_quote: As a pure devotee Shiva is actually situated in pure devotional service therefore he is always enlightened as a pure devotee but when he plays the role of a devata then his knowledge is limited
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the question of how Lord Shiva, being a pure devotee, can be said to not know he was created by Krishna, explaining that Shiva's knowledge is limited when he acts as a devata.
segments.transcript: Next question. In Bhagavad Gita 10.8 purport second last it is mentioned the patriarch patriarch Shiva and others let me open that 10.8 yeah are created by me though they do not know that they are created by me because they are deluded kindly explain kindly explain kindly explain how Lord Shiva being a pure devotee cannot know that he was created by the Supreme Lord. Now Krishna is the ultimate source of everyone and everything that is explained in all the scriptures including Bhagavad Gita and the Vedanta Sutra and the Srimad Bhagavatam and everything else. Okay now when Shiva appears at a certain stage of the creation process now Shiva appears either as the son of Brahma or he appears as the generated personality from Garbhodakshayi Vishnu in either case Shiva is not aware that he is part of a process of creation initiated by the Supreme Lord only that he does not know so as a pure devotee Shiva is actually situated in pure devotional service therefore he is always enlightened as a pure devotee but when he plays the role of a devata then his knowledge is limited his powers are limited

segments.key_quote: In his role as a devata he plays the role of a devata because he is a pure devotee to assist the Supreme Lord he is ready to do any seva so one of the services he does is he plays the part of a devata
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain Shiva's role as a devata, emphasizing that he serves the Supreme Lord in this capacity, and that his knowledge is limited in this role.
segments.transcript: his specific duty as the devata is also well defined he has certain limited amount of power which he can exercise as a devata like that so how is it that Lord Shiva being a pure devotee cannot know he is created by the Supreme Lord in his role as a devata he plays the role of a devata because he is a pure devotee to assist the Supreme Lord he is ready to do any seva so one of the services he does is he plays the part of a devata and many different forms of Shiva are there in this material world as devata many forms the Rudra forms there are 11 incarnations or forms of Rudra for different functions different purposes in this material world material world is very complex huge manifestation so the forms of the Rudras are actually forms of Shiva only so that way Shiva is actually playing the part of a devata and as a devata he does not know everything or details about who is Krishna what are the powers of Krishna how Krishna is the source Krishna is the ultimate control he does not know

segments.key_quote: Bhagavan the word Bhagavan originally applies only to the Supreme Lord Vishnu and his expansions Krishna Rama Narasimha etc
segments.summary: The speaker explains why personalities other than Vishnu are addressed as Bhagavan, attributing it to their extraordinary power and empowerment as confidential servants of the Supreme Lord.
segments.transcript: why are personalities other than Vishnu addressed as Bhagavan in Srimad Bhagavatam Bhagavan the word Bhagavan originally applies only to the Supreme Lord Vishnu and his expansions Krishna Rama Narasimha etc now Bhagavan can also be used for a person who is exceptionally powerful in the material world and therefore Shiva is addressed as Bhagavan sometimes sometimes great devotees are addressed as Bhagavan that is because of their extraordinary qualities extraordinary service they have to render like Narada he is empowered to preach devotional service in the entire universe he travels freely and he tries to preach but most people are not interested in devotional service so he will not always have a opportunity or a favorable situation to preach but he keeps searching for somebody who may be interested in the whole universe he travels and whoever shows interest he preaches to them makes them first class devotees example is Prahlad Maharaj so many examples there in the Bhagavatam so such great personalities as Narada Shiva pure devotee they are also addressed as Bhagavan indicating that they are extraordinarily empowered or very very powerful due to their being confidential servants of the supreme therefore they are also addressed as Bhagavan that means extraordinarily powerful extraordinarily empowered by the supreme

segments.key_quote: Buddha taught a meditation process he has taught a worship process he has taught a philosophy of life for those who are followers of the Buddhist scriptures he has taught everything
segments.summary: The speaker briefly addresses the teachings of Lord Buddha, mentioning meditation, worship, and a philosophy of life.
segments.transcript: what were the teachings of Lord Buddha apart from non-violence did he teach any meditation process yes Buddha taught a meditation process where do the present Buddhist get their teachings if they were not shadowed Lord Buddha has taught lot of things for the Buddhist who follow lot of things he has taught he has taught a meditation process he has taught a worship process he has taught a philosophy of life for those who are followers of the Buddhist scriptures he has taught everything they required he has taught

segments.key_quote: Conjunction means the junction sandhya it's called yuga sandhya just like in the evening after the sun sets still there is some light before it becomes fully dark
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of 'conjunction' in the context of Lord Kalki's appearance, using the analogy of twilight to describe the overlap between yugas.
segments.transcript: question Lord Kalki will appear at the conjunction of the two yugas what does conjunction mean conjunction means the junction sandhya it's called yuga sandhya just like in the evening after the sun sets still there is some light before it becomes fully dark so before the night begins or before the day ends completely there is one period where the sun is set but it is not fully dark so this short period about 15 minutes or 20 minutes is called sayam sandhya it's called dusk or twilight so that day is coming to an end night is beginning same thing happens in the similar thing happens in the morning when the sun before it rises there is already some light on the horizon eastern horizon so that is the night is ending and the day is beginning but it is not like night is over day has begun no it's not like that there is a overlap period so that overlap period is called conjunction of the day and night or night ending early morning it's night ending and evening it is conjunction of the day and night similarly the dwapar yuga is going to end and kali yuga is going to begin but when dwapar yuga ends there is some symptoms by which we can understand dwapar yuga is coming to a close and kali yuga symptoms start appearing gradually so that certain number of years is called the yuga sandhya or conjunction of the two yugas one is ending other one is beginning that's a conjunction so there is little overlap sometime

segments.key_quote: By studying bhagavatam or hearing bhagavatam or reading bhagavatam or distributing bhagavatam either as a book or as the knowledge itself all this will give us devotional service pure devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the benefits (phala shruti) of studying the Bhagavatam, explaining that it primarily leads to devotional service, but can also grant material benefits, mystic powers, or liberation to those who desire them.
segments.transcript: it is mentioned at the end of the chapters that we will get some fruits by reading the chapter how to understand these statements now phala shruti by hearing or reading or studying the bhagavatam for every episode that bhagavatam described there is some phala or fruits that is mentioned there bhagavatam is completely transcendental literature so by studying bhagavatam or hearing bhagavatam or reading bhagavatam or distributing bhagavatam either as a book or as the knowledge itself all this will give us devotional service pure devotional service but if somebody wants something else other than devotional service some material benefit or some mystic power or some liberation from material bondage and merging into the brahma jyoti anybody wants any of these they can get that also without separate endeavour they can get it provided they know this those are not pure devotees they engage in some worship of the supreme lord or they engage in some bhakti for some material gain or for attaining liberation for attaining some mystic for getting some mystic powers but that's not the real goal of performing devotional service or following some devotional principles the real goal is to actually become situated in pure devotional service that's the real goal so that goal of that benefit is always there for those who don't have desire for material enjoyment those who don't have desire for material prosperity for them only for them it is there that is the goal

segments.key_quote: Yajna ultimately means to satisfy vishnu or to please vishnu who is also called the chief beneficiary of the sacrificial offerings
segments.summary: The speaker explains the purpose of yajnas, which is to satisfy Vishnu, and discusses the specific goal of the rajasuya yajna, which is to declare sovereignty and glorify Krishna.
segments.transcript: next question why were big yajnas like rajasunya yajna performed are the goals of all yajnas the same or different now yajna ultimately means to satisfy vishnu or to please vishnu who is also called the chief beneficiary of the sacrificial offerings so to please vishnu or to satisfy vishnu one has to perform sacrifice now the goal of sacrifice again is ultimate liberation by transferring ourselves to the spiritual kingdom of god in a relationship with him that is the whole program so rajasuya now each of these yajnas have a common goal of pleasing vishnu but there is also another subsidiary goal or benefit or fruit or result so rajasuya yajna is done by an emperor of this world in order to declare his sovereignty his complete ruling over all the small provinces or all the states or all the regions like that and yudhishthira performed rajasuya yajna not because he wanted to enjoy royal opulence or any respect from others but because he wanted to show respect to krishna he wanted to glorify krishna he wanted krishna to be recognized as the most important person in that assembly in which so many devatas were invited so many rishis were invited so many great personalities of krishna were invited so all of them he wanted to hear krishna's glories he wanted to proclaim the unique position of krishna as the greatest supreme personality of god therefore he performed a rajasuya yajna so the common goal for all yajnas is pleasing vishnu by which we develop our bhakti for vishnu vishnu bhakti

segments.key_quote: All prescribed activities in devotional service or bhakti yoga are all methods of purification of the self only
segments.summary: The speaker discusses various methods of purification besides chanting Hare Krishna, including taking prasadam, hearing scriptures, and engaging in other prescribed activities of bhakti yoga.
segments.transcript: next question what are the other ways of purification of self besides chanting harikrishna in bhakti yoga itself there are many different practices for purification of self just like taking prasadam krishna prasadam is also purifying the self hearing bhagavad gita hearing bhagavatam scriptures reading the scriptures this also is purification of the self meant for the same so all prescribed activities in devotional service or bhakti yoga are all methods of purification

segments.key_quote: Rudra sampradaya is active among the followers of vallabhacharya in gujarat and rajasthan and vrindavan there are many many many followers of vallabhacharya
segments.summary: The speaker confirms that the Rudra sampradaya is still active, particularly among the followers of Vallabhacharya in Gujarat, Rajasthan, and Vrindavan.
segments.transcript: next question is the rudra sampradaya still existing the answer is yes as we do not see them active as compared to other sampradayas no rudra sampradaya is active among the followers of vallabhacharya in gujarat and rajasthan and vrindavan there are many many many followers of vallabhacharya so vallabhacharya was had appeared in that rudra sampradaya only vaishnava sampradaya so they are very very active even

segments.key_quote: For a pure devotee wherever the pure devotee is situated doesn't matter he is always with krishna through his consciousness krishna consciousness
segments.summary: The speaker explains how a Mahatma, or pure devotee, can be situated in the spiritual world even while living on Earth, emphasizing their constant connection with Krishna through Krishna consciousness.
segments.transcript: next question how is it that a mahatma referred to in gita is situated in the spiritual world though living on earth now mahatma means pure devotee according to the bhagavad gita apichesu duracharo bhajate mam ananya bhag sadhure eva samantabhya sadhu mahatma anastu mam partha daivim prakritim ashritaha bhajanti ananya manaso so that is the description of the mahatma in the bhagavad gita 9 chapter 13 verse so even though mahatma is situated in spiritual world he lives on the earth planet now for a pure devotee wherever the pure devotee is situated doesn't matter he is always with krishna through his consciousness krishna consciousness so that is how a devotee is always in touch with krishna is always a a devotee of krishna

segments.key_quote: Pure devotees also they are engaged in their eternal service to the supreme lord krishna in his krishna's personal about but krishna desires to deliver the conditions also the pure devotees also appear and assist in the mission of the supreme lord
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the role of pure devotees, explaining that they assist the Lord in his mission to deliver conditioned souls, even while remaining in the spiritual world.
segments.transcript: now the pure devotees they are always in the spiritual world but they also take birth in the material world or they appear with the lord in the material world when the lord appears just like krishna when he comes here he doesn't leave the spiritual world and come away no the spiritual world is never vacant of krishna krishna is eternally there but he also appears in this material also similarly pure devotees also they are engaged in their eternal service to the supreme lord krishna in his krishna's personal about but krishna desires to deliver the conditions also the pure devotees also appear and assist in the mission of the supreme lord or the mission of his pure devotees and in that way by assisting in those actions one is actually preparing oneself

segments.key_quote: Your faith is tested when in adverse conditions you still are able to continue with your devotional services
segments.summary: The speaker explains that one's faith in Krishna is tested by their ability to continue devotional service even in adverse conditions, and that continued practice is necessary for advancement.
segments.transcript: next question how do i know that my faith in krishna is strong and firm your faith is tested when in adverse conditions you still are able to continue with your devotional services so that is the test of faith or test of advancement if you are still not advanced then you have to practice more the preliminary basics

segments.key_quote: Devotional service begins with a small beginning like chanting 108 times hara krishna mantra every day takes about 10 minutes in the beginning
segments.summary: The speaker advises starting devotional service with small, regular practices like chanting and gradually increasing the time spent on spiritual life under the guidance of experienced devotees.
segments.transcript: next question i wanted to study the scriptures like gita bhagavatam scrutinizing me for eight hours a day under guidance of experienced devotees and also follow sadhana from four to nine am as prescribed are there any such opportunities now devotional service begins with a small beginning like chanting 108 times hara krishna mantra every day takes about 10 minutes in the beginning and after you become practiced you can chant in eight minutes or seven and a half minutes or seven minutes like that so make a small beginning and keep on doing that regularly every day on a daily basis and gradually introduce more and more and more practices one by one under the guidance of the devotees of srila prabhupada it is possible for anybody to learn the basics and actually become a fixed up in devotional service through such practices and eventually as you become more practiced accustomed to do some service and you keep on increasing the service instead of just chanting one round somebody will be told why don't you chant two rounds chant four rounds chant 16 rounds so then you require more time to chant 16 rounders compared to chanting one round so therefore the the devotional services gradually in a steady manner by practicing gradually increased more and more so you associate with devotees and you begin the practice and increase the the time you spend on spiritual life more and more and reduce the material time otherwise all time will go away and you will not be able to properly devote time for doing more and more devotional service

segments.key_quote: The reality of the truth is krishna bestows mercy on everyone it is that some people are not taking that mercy or are not ready to receive that mercy
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna bestows mercy on everyone, but some people are not ready or willing to receive it.
segments.transcript: next question is it possible to know the reasons why lord krishna bestows his mercy on some people and not on others the reality of the truth is krishna bestows mercy on everyone it is that some people are not taking that mercy or are not ready to receive that mercy

segments.key_quote: This chanting harry krishna means receiving the blessings and mercy of krishna through holy name that's what it means but not everybody will accept it not everybody will follow it
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of chanting Hare Krishna to illustrate how Krishna's mercy is available to all, but not everyone accepts or follows it, emphasizing Krishna's equality and fairness.
segments.transcript: it's like devotees tell so many people chant harry krishna now this chanting harry krishna means receiving the blessings and mercy of krishna through holy name that's what it means but not everybody will accept it not everybody will follow it even they accept sometimes so that is the difference because krishna is equal to everybody krishna is fair to everyone krishna wants everyone to be equal to everyone to become a devotee so therefore we cannot blame krishna or we cannot we should not think that krishna is partial to devotees samoham sarva bhuteshu so krishna is equal to everyone for him there is no distinction between bodies or between one person and another no he doesn't make distinction so if you feel that you are not getting krishna's mercy enough then if you understand that you have to become eligible to receive the mercy

segments.key_quote: All actions of vishnu are transcendental they are not under the more so material nature and whether he gets apparently defeated or he wins there is no difference between uh victory and defeat
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the transcendental nature of Vishnu's pastimes, explaining that apparent defeats or victories are not the same as in the material world and that they can be misleading to atheists.
segments.transcript: vishnu is engaged in past times with the pastimes which we cannot always appreciate simply by hearing the events it is just like rama was in the forest rama is the supreme lord only even the forest with sita devi and ravana kidnaps now and after that rama is lamenting sita where are you where are you i am missing you i cannot live without you he's crying and he is lamenting why did i lose sita how could i lost sita like that so it looks like he is a ordinary person but we know that from the proper authorities we hear that the supreme lord when he comes and plays the part of a um the supreme lord himself in some incarnation or as a devotee or something like that it is just a pastime for the sake of uh some function or some mission he has got in this material world for that purpose he comes so we cannot always detect that or always find that out on our own it's not possible so all actions of vishnu are transcendental they are not under the more so material nature and whether he gets apparently defeated or he wins there is no difference between uh victory and defeat or success and unsuccessful nothing like the no the duality is there in vishnu so therefore vishnu whatever he does it is good and all auspicious for everyone and he sometimes in the past times he appears to be depressed or dejected or he gets defeated or he is perplexed all these are misleading they are meant for misleading the atheists to think that krishna is ordinary person or rama is ordinary person but when actual fight takes place between rama and ravana then the way effortlessly rama killed ravan killed means delivered and that nobody can understand nobody can understand so the lord is to be understood only through the authentic scriptures through the descriptions of the pure devotees and the statements of the lord in the bhagavad-gita when lord reveals himself what are his activities like what are his characteristics what is his form like everything he reveals in the scriptures hear that that way become enlightened about god

segments.key_quote: Generally when we quit the body we immediately get the next body but in the case where somebody has been sinful then such a person is taken to yamaraj by the yamadukas where yamaraj's court the person is tried and is given a punishment
segments.summary: The speaker explains the process of obtaining the next body after death, noting that sinful individuals are judged by Yamaraj, while devotees may go back to Godhead or get another chance to continue their devotional service.
segments.transcript: how much time does it take for the living entity to get the next body after quitting the present body is there a standard process or differs for from each jiva or for each jiva okay generally when we quit the body we immediately get the next body but in the case where somebody has been sinful then such a person is taken to yamaraj by the yamadukas where yamaraj's court the person is tried and is given a punishment and then only the next so after punishment the next body that is where yamaraj comes in if somebody is not being sinful has been leading a pious life or has been a devotee then they are not under the particularly those are devotees they are not under the jurisdiction of yamaraj they are not under jurisdiction yamaraj so such devotees they either they go back to god if they are fully krishna conscious at the end of this life or if they're not fully krishna conscious then they get another chance to continue their devotional service till perfection that's the mercy of the supreme lord on

segments.key_quote: For those who are sinful they are taken to yamaraj and in yama raj's court they are tried and then uh they are punished and that punishment they have to suffer in one yatana sharira they are given a special body for getting the punishment experience of the pain experience of the suffering
segments.summary: The speaker continues to describe the fate of sinful individuals, explaining that they are punished in Yamaraj's court and experience suffering, but Paramatma is always with them.
segments.transcript: so for those who are sinful they are taken to yamaraj and in yama raj's court they are tried and then uh they are punished and that punishment they have to suffer in one yatana sharira they are given a special body for getting the punishment experience of the pain experience of the suffering and then after that they get the next part but all through paramatma is always with them as long as we have the material world

segments.key_quote: Paying obeisances is a practice of sadhana bhakti because we have a a false ego because of which we think we are great or we are the lord of the boss or the master but the process of bhakti is to become and to take a subordinate position
segments.summary: The speaker explains the importance of paying obeisances to Vaishnavas and Krishna as a practice of sadhana bhakti, emphasizing that it helps to overcome false ego, cultivate humility, and accelerate spiritual advancement.
segments.transcript: can you please explain the importance of paying obeisance to vaishnavas and krishna paying obeisances is a practice of sadhana bhakti because we have a a false ego because of which we think we are great or we are the lord of the boss or the master but the process of bhakti is to become and to take a subordinate position definitely subordinate to the lord and not only subordinate to the lord but subordinate to the lord's pure devotees so that is definitely required in order to progress in krishna consciousness so by paying obeisances to vaishnavas and krishna you make spiritual advancement you become humble and you get the blessings of the vaishnavas you get blessings of krishna and very quickly you will make advancement in krishna consciousness your advancement is accelerated every type of devotional service you practice your access your progress is accelerated so that is the benefit of following this uh practices as instructed in the authentic scriptures as taught by the bonafide spiritual master you will

segments.key_quote: The son of Rishabhdev, he was a pure devotee. He was called Bharat Maharaj and he was a pure devotee visible in the world. After him, the world was named Bharat Varsha.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that not all Bharatas mentioned in the Bhagavatam were pure devotees, identifying the son of Rishabhdev as the pure devotee after whom Bharat Varsha was named.
segments.transcript: were all Bharata mentioned in Bhagavatam pure devotees? No. which one of them ruled the world and was a pure devotee? pure devotee. The son of Rishabhdev, he was a pure devotee. He was called Bharat Maharaj and he was a pure devotee visible in the world. After him, the world was named Bharat Varsha.

segments.key_quote: In Vrindavan, lot of work is happening to improve the dilapidated condition of so many temples and also in Jagannath Puri, so much of renovation and improvement is happening in the Jagannath temple.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses a question about temple renovation, clarifying that Krishna temples are also being renovated and improved, citing examples in Vrindavan and Jagannath Puri.
segments.transcript: Next question, we see that Modiji is developing many places like Varanasi, Somnath. In Gujarat, main Dwaraka temple or place of Krishna not being recognized, is it possible for him to be renovated? Is his observation correct? No, this observation is not correct because in Vrindavan, lot of work is happening to improve the dilapidated condition of so many temples and also in Jagannath Puri, so much of renovation and improvement is happening in the Jagannath temple. One of the most important Vaishnava temples in the world. In Vrindavan, Vaishnava Kshetras, lot of work is happening. So, it's not true that only some places, it appears the way you're asking as if only place connected Shiva are being taken up and Krishna's temples are neglected. That's not true. It's not true at all. It's not correct. Even the temples of Krishna being taken up for improvement and renovation in

segments.key_quote: Nothing is complex in spiritual subject matter. It is just that it has to be properly explained by a self-realized person, just like Prabhupada explains.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the question of understanding complex spiritual matters, stating that nothing is complex if properly explained by a self-realized person like Prabhupada, and emphasizing the need to prepare one's consciousness and clear misconceptions.
segments.transcript: Even Jagannath Puri very, very big work is going on. I was there in Jagannath Puri about two weeks back and saw so much of work is happening. Lot of work is happening. It's going to be totally different in another one or one and a half years. Lot of work is happening. Next question, is it correct to think that the only way to properly understand complex spiritual matters is by giving up this material body and acquiring the spiritual body? Yes. No, actually, nothing is complex in spiritual subject matter. It is just that it has to be properly explained by a self-realized person, just like Prabhupada explains. Everything he explains very, very simple words and very clearly. Nothing which Prabhupada has written is complex or difficult to understand. That is one thing. Second thing is, we have to actually prepare our consciousness to receive this knowledge without any misconceptions about ourself or misconceptions about Krishna. So to clear the heart of these misconceptions is also a part of preparing oneself to properly

segments.key_quote: The correct way to understand spiritual subject matter is to prepare oneself by purification of the heart. What is this purification? To clear away the misconceptions which we have developed by long association with this material nature.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain how to understand spiritual matters, emphasizing the importance of purifying the heart by clearing away misconceptions through chanting Hare Krishna and understanding Prabhupada's teachings.
segments.transcript: If I think I'm the body. If my goal in life is some material sense gratification, many of these things will not make sense to me, even though it is written in a simple way, like Prabhupada and Krishna and Sukhadeva Goswami always explain, you are not the body, you are spirit soul. So somebody who is materialistic will think, what is the spirit soul? I don't agree. I think I am the body. There's nothing beyond the body. Like that, they will not understand. Either they will argue, they will differ in their opinion, or they will think somebody else is in ignorance, or they're having their own concoction. So many wrong ways they can actually interpret something and think it is either think it is very complex, and not bother about understanding what is nicely explained. So, the correct way to understand spiritual subject matter is to prepare oneself by purification of the heart. What is this purification? To clear away the misconceptions which we have developed by long association with this material nature. By long association, we have developed souls. So, purification of the heart. There are so many misconceptions. So, that can all be cleared away, you chant Hare Krishna, you hear the holy name, you understand what Prabhupada is explaining with a sober mind, then it's possible. And gradually you begin to build your foundation, build on a good foundation of understanding. So, that's the correct way. You start with the basic of understanding the basics from the Bhagavad Gita, then you proceed to the Bhagavatam, then to the chaitanya charitamrita. Everything can be understood. And also, Krishna is revealing within the heart for a sincere soul, who has developed the eagerness to know Krishna, to learn about Krishna, to hear about Krishna, develop the taste and attraction for Krishna, hearing about Krishna, Krishna reveals.

segments.key_quote: Shukadeva Goswami is the son of Vyasa Deva. Shukadeva Goswami was taught the Bhagavatam by Vyasa Deva. Vyasa Deva composed or compiled the Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies the roles of Shukadeva Goswami and Suta Goswami in the narration of the Bhagavatam, explaining their lineage and the circumstances of their speaking the scripture.
segments.transcript: Next question. Who is Shukadeva Goswami and Suta Goswami? I keep getting confused about both of them. Okay. Shukadeva Goswami is the son of Vyasa Deva. Shukadeva Goswami was taught the Bhagavatam by Vyasa Deva. Vyasa Deva composed or compiled the Bhagavatam. Shukadeva Goswami spoke the Bhagavatam to Pariksit Maharaj. Now, in that assembly where Shukadeva Goswami was speaking to Pariksit Maharaj, there were many other saintly persons. So, there was this other saintly person called Suta Goswami. Suta Goswami is the son of one Romaharshana Suta. This Suta Goswami is also called Ugrashrava Suta. He heard the Bhagavatam when Shukadeva Goswami was speaking to Pariksit Maharaj. Suta Goswami was requested by some sages in Naimisharanya, kindly tell us about Krishna. So Suta Goswami said, if you are interested in hearing about Krishna, I shall narrate to you the Srimad Bhagavatam which I heard from Shukadeva Goswami when he was speaking to Pariksit Maharaj. So that Suta Goswami, he's narrating about Krishna. So, that's Suta Goswami. So, this is the reason for repeating the Bhagavatam to the sages of Naimisharanya.

segments.key_quote: Maitreya Rishi is one of the sages. He actually attained enlightenment by hearing from his Guru. There is a disciplic succession in which Maitreya Rishi appears. Maitreya Rishi speaks to Vidura, enlightens Vidura.
segments.summary: The speaker identifies Maitreya Rishi and explains how he attained enlightenment through hearing from his Guru in a disciplic succession, tracing it back to Lord Sankarsana and the Kumaras.
segments.transcript: Romaharshana Suta was the disciple of Vyasadeva. Romaharshana Suta was taught by Vyasadeva about the Puranas, Itihasas, the Fifth Veda, like that. Okay. Who is Maitreya Rishi? How did he get enlightenment? Maitreya Rishi is one of the sages. He actually attained enlightenment by hearing from his Guru. I don't have the immediate term. Wait a minute. I'll tell you. Who was his Guru? There is a disciplic succession in which Maitreya Rishi appears. Maitreya Rishi speaks to Vidura, enlightens Vidura. The Srimad Bhagavatam was first spoken by Lord Sankarsana to Sanath Kumara. Sanath Kumara is one of the Four Kumaras. And Sanath Kumara spoke this Bhagavatam what he heard from Sankarsana to one Sankhyayana Muni and this Sankhyayana Muni spoke this Bhagavatam to Parashara. And Parashara taught this Bhagavatam to Maitreya Rishi. And Maitreya Rishi spoke this Bhagavatam to Vidura. So, this Maitreya Rishi comes in this parampara, Kumarasampradaya. We say Kumarasampradaya, Kumara Vaishnavasampradaya. Kumaras first

segments.key_quote: In the spiritual world, everyone is naturally always blissful, always blissful, the very quality of it, always blissful, always blissful. Being happy is the characteristic of spiritual existence. Whereas the material world, by nature, it is filled with miseries.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the possibility of sense gratification in the spiritual world, explaining that spiritual senses and bodies exist there, and that the natural state is bliss, contrasting it with the misery-filled material world where happiness is sought through sense gratification.
segments.transcript: Is it possible to do sense gratification in the spiritual world? Where does the desire to do sense gratification come from? How is this taken care of in the spiritual world? In the spiritual world, we have our spiritual senses. We have our spiritual body, we have spiritual mind. How can be we doing sense gratification in the spiritual world? How do we be having the mind. Have means the soul has got all these faculties without separate parts, unlike this material body, which is constructed by joining together different parts and interconnecting them in the womb of the mother. So it's a very complex process. But the spiritual spirit soul as a person, the spiritual personality has got all the faculties perfectly working without any separate parts joined together, no separate parts are there. The faculties are all there in the spiritual world. And in the spiritual world, everyone is naturally always blissful, always blissful, the very quality of it, always blissful, always blissful. Being happy is the characteristic of spiritual existence. Whereas the material world, by nature, it is filled with miseries. There is no natural happiness. And one has to seek happiness all the time. And that also is available by some sense contact. Because our nature is to be happy always in the spiritual world, when we come to the material world, we are material world we also want to be always happy, but there is no happiness. So therefore, we seek happiness and only way we can seek happiness is by sense gratification. That means we have to bring the senses in contact with sense objects and that sensation that is produced we think that that is happiness. So that is the defect of material existence.
